LS.InteractiveController.name: LS.InteractiveController
LS.InteractiveController.description:
Allows to easily test interaction between the user and the scene, attach the InteractiveController to the root and the mouse down,move and up events will
be processed using a raycast and trigger events.

LS.Knob.name: LS.Knob
LS.Knob.description: Knob allows to rotate a mesh like a knob (rotate when dragging)

LS.Light.name: LS.Light
LS.Light.description: Light that contains the info about the camera

LS.LightFX.name: LS.LightFX
LS.LightFX.description: LightFX create volumetric and flare effects to the light

LS.Components.MeshRenderer.name: LS.Components.MeshRenderer
LS.Components.MeshRenderer.description: Renders one mesh, it allows to configure the rendering primitive, the submesh (range of mesh) and a level of detail mesh

LS.Components.NodeManipulator.name: LS.Components.NodeManipulator
LS.Components.NodeManipulator.description: Node manipulator, allows to rotate it

LS.Components.PlayAnimation.name: LS.Components.PlayAnimation
LS.Components.PlayAnimation.description: Reads animation tracks from an Animation resource and applies the properties to the objects referenced

LS.Components.Script.name: LS.Components.Script
LS.Components.Script.description:
Script must be coded in Javascript and they have full access to all the engine, so one script could replace the behaviour of any part of the engine.
Scripts are executed inside their own context, the context is local to the script so any variable defined in the context that is not attached to the context wont be accessible from other parts of the engine.
To interact with the engine Scripts must bind callback to events so the callbacks will be called when those events are triggered, however, there are some generic methods that will be called

LS.Components.SkinDeformer.name: LS.Components.SkinDeformer
LS.Components.SkinDeformer.description:
It applyes skinning to a RenderInstance created by another component (usually MeshRenderer)
Is in charge of gathering the bone nodes and adding to the RenderInstance the information needed to perform the skinning
It can do it using shader uniforms (simple way), a matrices texture (complex way), or by directly applying skinning by software (slow but well supported way)
It also allow to limit the bone search to specific nodes.

LS.Components.Spherize.name: LS.Components.Spherize
LS.Components.Spherize.description: Spherize deforms a mesh, it is an example of a deformer, a component that modifies the meshes of one node

LS.Components.Target.name: LS.Components.Target
LS.Components.Target.description: Target rotate a mesh to look at the camera or another object

LS.Components.TextureFX.name: LS.Components.TextureFX
LS.Components.TextureFX.description:
helps apply basic effects to a texture with as fewer render calls as possible with low memory footprint
used by CameraFX but also available for any other use

LS.Material.name: LS.Material
LS.Material.description:
A Material is a class in charge of defining how to render an object, there are several classes for Materials
but this class is more like a template for other material classes.

LS.ShaderMaterial.name: LS.ShaderMaterial
LS.ShaderMaterial.description: ShaderMaterial allows to use your own shader from scratch, but you loose some of the benefits of using the dynamic shader system of LS

LS.StandardMaterial.name: LS.StandardMaterial
LS.StandardMaterial.description: StandardMaterial class improves the material class

LS.RenderInstance.name: LS.RenderInstance
LS.RenderInstance.description: RenderInstance contains info of one object to be rendered on the scene.

LS.RenderSettings.name: LS.RenderSettings
LS.RenderSettings.description: There could be different renderSettings for different scene quality.

LS.Renderer.name: LS.Renderer
LS.Renderer.description: The Renderer is in charge of generating one frame of the scene. Contains all the passes and intermediate functions to create the frame.

LS.Animation.name: LS.Animation
LS.Animation.description:
An Animation is a resource that contains samples of properties over time, similar to animation curves
Values could be associated to an specific node.
Data is contained in tracks

LS.Animation.Track.name: LS.Animation.Track
LS.Animation.Track.description:
Represents one track with data over time about one property
Data could be stored in two forms, or an array containing arrays of [time,data] (unpacked data) or in a single typed array (packed data), depends on the attribute typed_mode

LS.Pack.name: LS.Pack
LS.Pack.description: Pack is an object that contain several resources, helpful when you want to carry a whole scene in one single file

LS.Prefab.name: LS.Prefab
LS.Prefab.description:
Prefab work in two ways: 
- It can contain a node structure and all the associated resources (textures, meshes, animations, etc)
- When a node in the scene was created from a Prefab, the prefab is loaded so the associated resources are recovered, but the node structure is not modified.

LS.Resource.name: LS.Resource
LS.Resource.description:
This class contains all the info about a resource and it works as a template for any resource class
Keep in mind that there are many resource classes like Meshes or Textures that dont inherit from this class.
This class is used mainly to generic file resources like text files (scripts, csvs, etc)

LS.ShaderCode.name: LS.ShaderCode
LS.ShaderCode.description:
ShaderCode is a resource containing all the code associated to a shader
It is used to define special ways to render scene objects, having full control of the rendering algorithm
Having a special class helps to parse the data in advance and share it between different materials

LS.Draw.name: LS.Draw
LS.Draw.description:
LS.Draw allows to render basic primitives, similar to the OpenGL Fixed pipeline.
It reuses local meshes when possible to avoid fragmenting the VRAM.

LS.LScript.name: LS.LScript
LS.LScript.description: LScript allows to compile code during execution time having a clean context

LS.WBin.name: LS.WBin
LS.WBin.description: WBin allows to create binary files easily (similar to WAD format). You can pack lots of resources in one file or extract them.

LS.Component.name: LS.Component
LS.Component.description:
This is an example class for a component, should never be instantiated by itself, 
instead components get all the methods from this class attached when the component is registered.
Components can overwrite this methods if they want.

LS.ComponentContainer.name: LS.ComponentContainer
LS.ComponentContainer.description: ComponentContainer class allows to add component based properties to any other class

LS.CompositePattern.name: LS.CompositePattern
LS.CompositePattern.description:
CompositePattern implements the Composite Pattern, which allows to one class to contain instances of its own class
creating a tree-like structure.

LS.LS.name: LS.LS
LS.LS.description: LS is the global scope for the global functions and containers of LiteScene

LSQ.name: LSQ
LSQ.description: LSQ allows to set or get values easily from the global scene, using short strings as identifiers

LS.Formats.name: LS.Formats
LS.Formats.description: Formats is the class where all the info about what is every format, how to parse it, etc, is located

params.name: id

LS.Collision.name: LS.Collision
LS.Collision.description:
Contains information about the collision of a ray and the scene
- position: vec3
- node: SceneNode
- instance: could be a RenderInstance or a PhysicsInstance
- distance: number

LS.PhysicsInstance.name: LS.PhysicsInstance
LS.PhysicsInstance.description: PhysicsInstance contains info of a colliding object. Used to test collisions with the scene

LS.Physics.name: LS.Physics
LS.Physics.description: Physics is in charge of all physics testing methods

LS.Picking.name: LS.Picking
LS.Picking.description: Picking is used to detect which element is below one pixel (used the GPU) or using raycast

LS.Player.name: LS.Player
LS.Player.description:
Player class allows to handle the app context easily without having to glue manually all events
	There is a list of options
	==========================
	- canvas: the canvas where the scene should be rendered, if not specified one will be created
	- container_id: string with container id where to create the canvas, width and height will be those from the container
	- width: the width for the canvas in case it is created without a container_id
	- height: the height for the canvas in case it is created without a container_id
	- resources: string with the path to the resources folder
	- shaders: string with the url to the shaders.xml file
	- proxy: string with the url where the proxy is located (useful to avoid CORS)
	- filesystems: object that contains the virtual file systems info { "VFS":"http://litefileserver.com/" } ...
	- redraw: boolean to force to render the scene constantly (useful for animated scenes)
	- autoresize: boolean to automatically resize the canvas when the window is resized
	- autoplay: boolean to automatically start playing the scene once the load is completed
	- loadingbar: boolean to show a loading bar
	Optional callbacks to attach
	============================
	- onPreDraw: executed before drawing a frame
	- onDraw: executed after drawing a frame
	- onPreUpdate(dt): executed before updating the scene (delta_time as parameter)
	- onUpdate(dt): executed after updating the scene (delta_time as parameter)
	- onMouse(e): when a mouse event is triggered
	- onKey(e): when a key event is triggered

params.name: options
params.description: settings for the webgl context creation

LS.Project.name: LS.Project
LS.Project.description:
The Project is the top-most object that contains the whole application, from the project we can load other scenes
Still a work in progress

Static class that contains all the resources loaded, parsed and ready to use.
It also contains the parsers and methods in charge of processing them

LS.SceneTree.name: LS.SceneTree

The SceneNode class represents and object in the scene
Is the base class for all objects in the scene as meshes, lights, cameras, and so

LS.ShaderQuery.description: ShaderQuery is in charge of specifying info that must be taken into account when compiling a shader

classitems.description:
Returns an object with a representation of the resource internal data
The order to obtain that object is:
0. checks if getDataToStore function in resource
1. test for _original_file (File or Blob)
2. test for _original_data (ArrayBuffer)
3. toBinary() (ArrayBuffer)
4. toBlob() (Blob)
5. toBase64() (String)
6. serialize() (Object in JSON format)
7. data property 
8. JSON.stringify(...)
classitems.name: Resource.getDataToStore

return.description: it has two fields: data and encoding

params.name: url
params.description: could be an array with urls to load in order

params.name: on_progress
params.description: (if several files are required, on_progress is called after every file is added to the DOM)

classitems.description: Computes the instance bounding box in world space from the one in local space
classitems.name: updateAABB

classitems.description: Cast a ray that traverses the scene checking for collisions with Colliders
classitems.name: raycast

params.name: options
params.description: ( max_dist maxium distance, layers which layers to check, scene, first_collision )

return.description: Array of Collision objects containing all the nodes that collided with the ray or null in the form [SceneNode, Collider, collision point, distance]

classitems.description: Test if a sphere collides with any of the colliders in the scene
classitems.name: testSphere

return.description: the first PhysicsObject that collided with, otherwise null

classitems.description: Renders the pixel and retrieves the color to detect which object it was, slow but accurate
classitems.name: getNodeAtCanvasPosition

classitems.description: Returns the instance under a screen position
classitems.name: getInstanceAtCanvasPosition

return.description: the info supplied by the picker (usually a SceneNode)

classitems.description:
Cast a ray that traverses the scene checking for collisions with RenderInstances
Similar to Physics.raycast but using only the bounding boxes of the visible meshes
classitems.name: raycast

params.name: options
params.description: ( max_distance: maxium ray distance, layers, scene, max_distance, first_collision : returns the first collision (which could be not the closest one) )

return.description: array containing all the RenderInstances that collided with the ray in the form [SceneNode, RenderInstance, collision point, distance]

classitems.description:
Returns a color you should use to paint this node during picking rendering
you tell what info you want to retrieve associated with this object if it is clicked
classitems.name: getNextPickingColor

return.description: array containing all the RenderInstances that collided with the ray

classitems.description: Loads an scene and triggers start
classitems.name: loadScene

params.name: url
params.description: url to the JSON file containing all the scene info

params.name: on_complete
params.description: callback trigged when the scene and the resources are loaded

classitems.description: loads Scene from object or JSON
classitems.name: setScene

params.name: on_complete
params.description: callback trigged when the scene and the resources are loaded

classitems.description: Returns a string to append to any url that should use the browser cache (when updating server info)
classitems.name: getNoCache

params.name: force
params.description: force to return a nocache string ignoring the default configuration

return.description: a string to attach to a url so the file wont be cached

classitems.description: Resets all the resources cached, so it frees the memory
classitems.name: reset

classitems.description:
Resources need to be parsed once the data has been received, some formats could be parsed using native functions (like images) others 
require to pass the data through a series of functions (extract raw content, parse it, upload it to the GPU...
Registering a resource preprocessor the data will be converted once it is in memory
classitems.name: registerResourcePreProcessor

params.name: fileformats
params.description: the extension of the formats that this function will parse

params.name: callback
params.description: the function to call once the data must be processed, if the process is async it must return true

classitems.description:
Some resources require to be post-processed right after being parsed to validate, extend, register (meshes need to have the AABB computed...)
This job could be done inside the parser but it is better to do it separatedly so it can be reused among different parsers.
classitems.name: registerResourcePostProcessor

params.name: resource_type
params.description: the name of the class of the resource

params.name: callback
params.description: the function to call once the data has been processed

classitems.description: Returns the filename extension from an url
classitems.name: getExtension

params.name: complex_extension
params.description: [optional] returns the extension from the first dot, otherwise only the part from last dot

classitems.description: Returns the url without the extension
classitems.name: removeExtension

params.name: complex_extension
params.description: [optional] removes the extension from the first dot, otherwise only the part from last dot

classitems.description: Returns the filename from a full path
classitems.name: getFilename

classitems.description: Returns the folder from a fullpath
classitems.name: getFolder

classitems.description: Returns the filename without the folder or the extension
classitems.name: getBasename

classitems.description: Cleans resource name (removing double slashes)
classitems.name: cleanFullpath

classitems.description: Loads all the resources in the Object (it uses an object to store not only the filename but also the type)
classitems.name: loadResources

params.name: resources
params.description: contains all the resources, associated with its type

params.name: options
params.description: options to apply to the loaded resources

classitems.description:
Set the base path where all the resources will be fetched (unless they have absolute URL)
By default it will use the website home address
classitems.name: setPath

classitems.description:
Set a proxy url where all non-local resources will be requested, allows to fetch assets to other servers.
request will be in this form: proxy_url + "/" + url_with_protocol: ->   http://myproxy.com/google.com/images/...
classitems.name: setProxy

classitems.description: transform a url to a full url taking into account proxy, virtual file systems and local_repository
classitems.name: getFullURL

classitems.description:
Allows to associate a resource path like "vfs:myfile.png" to an url according to the value before the ":".
This way we can have alias for different folders where the assets are stored.
P.e:   "e","http://domain.com"  -> will transform "e:myfile.png" in "http://domain.com/myfile.png"
classitems.name: registerFileSystem

params.name: name
params.description: the filesystem name (the string before the colons in the path)

classitems.description: Returns the resource if it has been loaded, if you want to force to load it, use load
classitems.name: getResource

params.name: url
params.description: where the resource is located (if its a relative url it depends on the path attribute)

params.name: constructor
params.description: [optional] allows to specify the class expected for this resource, if the resource doesnt match, it returns null

classitems.description: Returns the resource type ("Mesh","Texture","Material","SceneNode",...) of a given resource
classitems.name: getResourceType

classitems.description: Marks the resource as modified, used in editor to know when a resource data should be updated
classitems.name: resourceModified

classitems.description: Unmarks the resource as modified
classitems.name: resourceSaved

classitems.description:
Loads a generic resource, the type will be infered from the extension, if it is json or wbin it will be processed
Do not use to load regular files (txts, csv, etc), instead use the LS.Network methods
classitems.name: load

params.name: url
params.description: where the resource is located (if its a relative url it depends on the path attribute)

params.name: options
params.description: options to apply to the loaded resource when processing it

params.name: on_complete
params.description: callback when the resource is loaded and cached, params: callback( resource, url  ) //( url, resource, options )

classitems.description:
Takes some resource data and transforms it to a resource (and Object ready to be used by the engine) and REGISTERs it in the ResourcesManager.
In most cases the process involves parsing and uploading to the GPU
It is called for every single resource that comes from an external source (URL) right after being loaded
classitems.name: processResource

params.name: url
params.description: where the resource is located (if its a relative url it depends on the path attribute)

params.name: data
params.description: the data of the resource (could be string, arraybuffer, image... )

params.name: options
params.description: options to apply to the loaded resource

classitems.description: Takes a resource instance, and adds some extra properties and register it
classitems.name: processFinalResource

params.name: url
params.description: where the resource is located (if its a relative url it depends on the path attribute)

params.name: options
params.description: options to apply to the loaded resource

classitems.description: Stores the resource inside the manager containers. This way it will be retrieveble by anybody who needs it.
classitems.name: registerResource

classitems.description: removes the resources from all the containers
classitems.name: unregisterResource

return.description: true is removed, false if not found

classitems.description: Used to load files and get them as File (or Blob)
classitems.name: getURLasFile

classitems.description: Changes the name of a resource and sends an event to all components to change it accordingly
classitems.name: renameResource

params.name: skip_event
params.description: ignore sending an event to all components to rename the resource

classitems.description: Tells if it is loading resources
classitems.name: isLoading

classitems.description: forces to try to reload again resources not found
classitems.name: isLoading

classitems.description: returns a mesh resource if it is loaded
classitems.name: getMesh

classitems.description: returns a texture resource if it is loaded
classitems.name: getTexture

params.name: filename
params.description: could be a texture itself in which case returns the same texture

classitems.description: Binds a callback for when a resource is loaded (in case you need to do something special)
classitems.name: onceLoaded

params.name: fullpath
params.description: of the resource you want to get the notification once is loaded

params.name: callback
params.description: the function to call, it will be called as callback( fullpath, resource )

classitems.description:
This initializes the content of the scene.
Call it to clear the scene content
classitems.name: init

classitems.description:
Clears the scene using the init function
and trigger a "clear" LEvent
classitems.name: clear

classitems.description: Fired when the whole scene is cleared
classitems.name: clear

classitems.description:
Configure the Scene using an object (the object can be obtained from the function serialize)
Inserts the nodes, configure them, and change the parameters
Destroys previously existing info
classitems.name: configure

params.name: scene_info
params.description: the object containing all the info about the nodes and config of the scene

classitems.description: Fired after the scene has been configured
classitems.name: configure

params.name: scene_info
params.description: contains all the info to do the configuration

classitems.description:
Creates and object containing all the info about the scene and nodes.
The oposite of configure.
It calls the serialize method in every node
classitems.name: serialize

return.description: return a JS Object with all the scene info

classitems.description: Fired after the scene has been serialized to an object
classitems.name: serialize

classitems.description:
Loads a scene from a relative url pointing to a JSON description
Warning: this url is not passed through the LS.ResourcesManager so the url is absolute
classitems.name: load

params.name: url
params.description: where the JSON object containing the scene is stored

params.name: on_complete
params.description: the callback to call when the loading is complete

params.name: on_error
params.description: the callback to call if there is a  loading error

params.name: on_progress
params.description: it is called while loading the scene info (not the associated resources)

params.name: on_resources_loaded
params.description: it is called when all the resources had been loaded

classitems.description: Fired before loading scene
classitems.name: beforeLoad

classitems.description: Fired when the scene has been loaded but before the resources
classitems.name: load

classitems.description: Fired after all resources have been loaded
classitems.name: loadCompleted

classitems.description: Returns an array with all the cameras enabled in the scene
classitems.name: getActiveCameras

params.name: force
params.description: [optional] if you want to collect the cameras again, otherwise it returns the last ones collected

classitems.description: Returns an array with all the lights enabled in the scene
classitems.name: getActiveLights

params.name: force
params.description: [optional] if you want to collect the lights again, otherwise it returns the last ones collected

classitems.description: Fired when a new node is added to this scene
classitems.name: nodeAdded

classitems.description: Fired after a node has been removed
classitems.name: nodeRemoved

classitems.description: retrieves a Node based on the name, path ( name|childname|etc ) or uid
classitems.name: getNode

return.description: the node or null if it didnt find it

classitems.description:
retrieves a Node that matches that name. It is fast because they are stored in an object.
If more than one object has the same name, the first one added to the tree is returned
classitems.name: getNodeByName

return.description: the node or null if it didnt find it

classitems.description: retrieves a Node based on a given uid. It is fast because they are stored in an object
classitems.name: getNodeByUId

return.description: the node or null if it didnt find it

classitems.description: retrieves a Node by its index
classitems.name: getNodeByIndex

return.description: returns the node at the 'index' position in the nodes array

classitems.description: retrieves a node array filtered by the filter function
classitems.name: filterNodes

params.name: filter
params.description: a callback function that receives every node and must return true or false

return.description: array containing the nodes that passes the filter

classitems.description: searches the component with this uid, it iterates through all the nodes and components (slow)
classitems.name: findComponentByUId

classitems.description: searches the material with this uid, it iterates through all the nodes (slow)
classitems.name: findMaterialByUId

classitems.description:
Returns information of a node component property based on the locator of that property
Locators are in the form of "{NODE_UID}/{COMPONENT_UID}/{property_name}"
classitems.name: getPropertyInfo

return.description: object with node, component, name, and value

classitems.description:
Returns information of a node component property based on the locator of that property
Locators are in the form of "{NODE_UID}/{COMPONENT_UID}/{property_name}"
classitems.name: getPropertyInfoFromPath

return.description: object with node, component, name, and value

classitems.description:
Assigns a value to the property of a component in a node based on the locator of that property
Locators are in the form of "{NODE_UID}/{COMPONENT_UID}/{property_name}"
classitems.name: setPropertyValue

params.name: root
params.description: [Optional] if you want to limit the locator to search inside a node

return.description: the target where the action was performed

classitems.description:
Assigns a value to the property of a component in a node based on the locator that property
Locators are in the form of "{NODE_UID}/{COMPONENT_UID}/{property_name}"
classitems.name: setPropertyValueFromPath

params.name: root_node
params.description: [optional] the root node where you want to search the locator (this is to limit the locator to a branch of the scene tree)

params.name: offset
params.description: [optional] used to avoir generating garbage, instead of slicing the array every time, we pass the array index

return.description: the target where the action was performed

classitems.description:
Returns the resources used by the scene
includes the nodes, components and preloads
classitems.name: getResources

classitems.description:
Loads all the resources of all the nodes in this scene
it sends a signal to every node to get all the resources info
and load them in bulk using the ResourceManager
classitems.name: loadResources

params.name: on_complete
params.description: called when the load of all the resources is complete

classitems.description: Adds a resource that must be loaded when the scene is loaded
classitems.name: addPreloadResource

classitems.description: Remove a resource from the list of resources to preload
classitems.name: removePreloadResource

classitems.description: start the scene (triggers an "start" event)
classitems.name: start

classitems.description: Fired when the nodes need to be initialized
classitems.name: init

classitems.description: Fired when the scene is starting to play
classitems.name: start

classitems.description: stop the scene (triggers an "finish" event)
classitems.name: finish

classitems.description: Fired when the scene stops playing
classitems.name: finish

classitems.description: renders the scene using the assigned renderer
classitems.name: render

classitems.description:
This methods crawls the whole tree and collects all the useful info (cameras, lights, render instances, colliders, etc)
Mostly rendering stuff but also some collision info.
classitems.name: collectData

classitems.description: Fired before doing an update
classitems.name: beforeUpdate

classitems.description: Fired while updating
classitems.name: update

classitems.description: Fired after updating the scene
classitems.name: afterUpdate

classitems.description: triggers an event to all nodes in the scene
classitems.name: triggerInNodes

params.name: data
params.description: data to send associated to the event

classitems.description: generate a unique node name given a prefix
classitems.name: generateUniqueNodeName

params.name: prefix
params.description: the prefix, if not given then "node" is used

return.description: a node name that it is not in the scene

classitems.description: Marks that this scene must be rendered again
classitems.name: refresh

classitems.description: returns current scene time (remember that scene time remains freezed if the scene is not running)
classitems.name: getTime

classitems.description: returns an array with the name of all the layers given a layers mask
classitems.name: getLayerNames

params.name: layers
params.description: a number with the enabled layers in bit mask format, if ommited all layers are returned

return.description: array of strings with the layer names

classitems.description: returns an array with all the components in the scene and scenenodes that matches this class
classitems.name: findNodeComponents

params.name: type
params.description: the type of the components to search (could be a string with the name or the class itself)

classitems.description: returns a pack containing all the scene and resources, used to save a scene to harddrive
classitems.name: toPack

classitems.description: changes the node name
classitems.name: setName

return.description: returns true if the name changed

classitems.description: Node changed name
classitems.name: name_changed

classitems.description: Assigns this node to one layer
classitems.name: setLayer

classitems.description: Returns the root node of the prefab incase it is inside a prefab, otherwise null
classitems.name: insidePrefab

return.description: returns the node where the prefab starts

classitems.description: remember clones this node and returns the new copy (you need to add it to the scene to see it)
classitems.name: clone

return.description: returns a cloned version of this node

classitems.description: Configure this node from an object containing the info
classitems.name: configure

params.name: info
params.description: the object with all the info (comes from the serialize method)

classitems.description:
Serializes this node by creating an object with all the info
it contains info about the components too
classitems.name: serialize

params.name: ignore_prefab
params.description: serializing wont returns children if it is a prefab, if you set this to ignore_prefab it will return all the info

return.description: returns the object with the info

classitems.description: Initializes the shader manager
classitems.name: init

params.name: url
params.description: a url to a shaders.xml can be specified to load the shaders

classitems.description: Reloads the XML file with the shaders, useful when editing the file
classitems.name: reloadShaders

params.name: on_complete
params.description: call when the shaders have been reloaded

classitems.description: Resolves a shader query, returns the shader
classitems.name: resolve

return.description: the shader, if not found the default shader is returned

classitems.description: Clears all the compiled shaders
classitems.name: clearCache

classitems.description: Returns a compiled shader with this id and this macros
classitems.name: get

return.description: the shader, if not found the default shader is returned

classitems.description: Returns the info of a global shader
classitems.name: getGlobalShaderInfo

classitems.description: Compiles a shader, the vertex and fragment shader are cached indepently to speed up compilations but a unique name must be provided
classitems.name: compileShader

params.name: vs_code
params.description: the final source code for the vertex shader

params.name: fs_code
params.description: the final source code for the fragment shader

params.name: name
params.description: an unique name that should be associated with this shader

classitems.description: Stores a compiled shader program, so it can be reused
classitems.name: registerCompiledShader

classitems.description: Loads shaders code from an XML file
classitems.name: loadFromXML

params.name: reset_old
params.description: to reset all the existing shaders once loaded

params.name: on_complete
params.description: callback once the file has been loaded and processed

classitems.description: extracts all the shaders from the XML doc
classitems.name: processShadersXML

classitems.description: extracts all the shaders from the XML doc
classitems.name: registerGlobalShader

classitems.description: Register a code snippet ready to be used by the #import clause in the shader
classitems.name: registerSnippet

classitems.description: Returns the code of a snipper
classitems.name: getSnippet

classitems.description: Create some default shaders useful for generic situations (flat, texture and screenspace quad)
classitems.name: createDefaultShaders

classitems.description: Samples a curve and returns the resulting value
classitems.name: getCurveValueAt

params.name: x
params.description: the position in the curve to sample

classitems.description: Resamples a full curve in values (useful to upload to GPU array)
